intro: Burmannia bicolor var. aprica, commonly known as the yellow burmannia, is a tropical flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow and green striped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
